broaden.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to increase something such as your knowledge, experience, or range of activities
broaden.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The course helps school-leavers broaden their knowledge of the world of work.
I’d like to work abroad to broaden my horizons  (=learn, experience, or attempt new things).
Travel broadens the mind  (=helps you to understand and accept other people’s beliefs, customs etc).
broaden.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to affect or include more people or things, or to make something affect or include more people or things
broaden.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Mr Mates said the party must broaden its appeal to younger voters.
Flynn’s appeal broadened as the campaign continued into the summer months.
I want to broaden the discussion to other aspects of the problem.
broaden.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to make something wider, or to become wider
broaden.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The council decided to broaden the pavement.
